column3: Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/p4916_31544d847d043812d0c644ddcec1231a81628690/ for binaries and test log.\nThis test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-te

NACK.
I switched this to netmasks on purpose, wildcards should not be used with network addresses.

Edit: better error reporting is nice though

NACK confusing to have wildcards which aren't actually wildcards

ie 192.168.*.0 should work with wildcards

@pstratem And then the next person will ask for '192.16_._.0', and so on. That's a recipe for feature creep. All these can be specified, if sometimes with multiple `rpcallowip` lines.\n\nHaving sane limitations such as allowing wildcards only at the end (or even only allowing '*') is a valid choice. That will be what most people are using. I think the discussion here should be whether we want to k

> NACK.
> I switched this to netmasks on purpose, wildcards should not be used with network addresses.
> 
> Edit: better error reporting is nice though  

Would you accept the patch if it were just the improved error messages?

@nickodell Sure! It always makes sense to split it up in a controversial part and a non-controversial part.

I didn't want to close this yet before giving other people a chance to give their opinion about reintroducing partial support for wildcards though.
Closing.  Please open a new pull request for the reworked error messages.\n
